intro: Hieracium camkorijense subsp. diaphanoidiceps, commonly known as the translucent-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and yellow composite flowers. The subspecies is notable for its thin, translucent leaf blades, which give it its common name. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant is relatively rare and has limited geographic distribution within its native range.
